result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Motion and prop. order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
10:06 AM cases 22CM282, 22CM356 called. Defendant Tara L McBride in court.  Attorney Jansen James Van Daalwyk in court for Tara L McBride.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense enters not guilty pleas which are accepted by the Court. Cases referred to branch 4 to schedule a status conference. `

(Cases 22CM282, 22CM356 are called at 11:02 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Tara L McBride appeared by video from WMHI.  Attorney Jansen James Van Daalwyk in court for Tara L McBride. Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense stipulates to Dr.'s report and findings. State stipulates to Dr.'s report and findings. Court finds the Defendant is competent to proceed. Defense withdraws Motion to Withdraw as Counsel- Attorney Van Daalwyk to remain as counsel. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 09/12/2022 at 1:30 PM. 
Hearing: 09/22/2022 at 9:30 AM.
Competency hearing on August 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Cases called at 3:30 PM: 22CM282, 22CM356.
Defendant Tara L McBride in court with Attorney Jansen James Van Daalwyk.  Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for State of Wisconsin.  
State notes that the Defendant has not yet completed the Competency Examination.  
Attorney Van Daalwyk indicates that the Defendant was in treatment through 6/24/22 and will now be available to complete the examination. 
Defendant instructed to contact Dr. Minter to make arrangements to complete the examination.
Court finds good cause to extend time limits.
Competency Hearing: 8/15/22 at 11:00 AM.
Dated 05/02/2022, Letter from Attorney Van Daalwyk to Clerk regarding Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Conditions:

Case called at 11:04 AM.
Defendant Tara L McBride appeared by video, in custody from the jail with Attorney Zebulon Patek. Attorney Afton Lewis appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.
State raises Competency. Court orders a Competency Evaluation in all of the Defendant's open cases.
Competency Hearing: 5/23/22 at 11:30 AM (Br 5).

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
